topic: HDRcapOSX re-write for Mac OS X 10.5.x/10.4.x
body:
Greg Ward's HDRcapOSX has been largely re-written to accommodate the  
changes in Mac OS X and the Canon SDK since the original version  
appeared. The re-write was carried out by my colleague Denis Fan.
CanonHDRcap is now supported under the Canon EDSDK version 2.4, and  
has been compiled under Mac OS X version 10.5.4 as an universal  
binary, backwards compatible up to Mac OS X version 10.4.x. Some  
modification of the CanonHDRcap are described as follows:
(a) The aperture size by default is set to 4 when it executes;
(b) LDR images are downloaded after the sequence of captures, rather  
than during the sequence;
(c) The ability of downloading both jpeg and raw data from the camera  
after the sequence of captures. If you use this option, by default  
canoncap would only execute hdrgen to generate the HDR image using the  
jpeg sequences.
Otherwise, the operation is as described in the original notes  
(included in the package).
Download it from here:
http://www.iesd.dmu.ac.uk/~jm/resources.html
-John
